bottle_text:
The Rare Wine Co.
Historic Series
Madiera
Boston Bual

2008
The Prince In His Caves
Farina Vineyards
notes: Cloudy yellow-orange. No tasting notes. Skin-fermented.
Pink Txakoli is one of the best things in the whole world.
Pale yellow-green. Hay and wax on the nose. Almost sweet on the tongue, though with acid balance and strong tannins.
Golden yellow. Honeysuckle. A bit too sweet, unstructured and thin. No comparison to the Jefferson Viognier.
Bright orange. Smells strongly of fruit, but the taste is unmistakably tart and funky. Strong tannins.
Perhaps overly sweet. Stone fruit and some acidity, though not enough. Single-note.

grapes:
25% Malvasia di Candia Aromatica
25% Marsanne
25% Ortrugo (Trebbiano di Tortona)
25% unidentified
notes: Bright orange. Funky, tart and tannic.
Straw to almost light green color. Very sweet nose, but crisp and properly acidic.
Bright pink. Tart and tangy. Slightly effervescent. Nicely dry.

bottle_text:
Moulin de Gassac
Guilhem
2012
Pays D'Herault
notes: Acceptably acidic. Reasonable fruit, clean and minerally finish.

bottle_text:
Commanderie de Peyrassol
Cotes de Provence
2012
notes: Grapefruit pink-red. Stouter than most roses. Dry, and flinty but with a tiny acidic kick.
Always good. A little jammy but nothing that would make you think Cabernet. Enough earth to keep things reasonable.
Just love this wine. Lucky to even get a bottle. Bubbles go with everything.
Lots of hidden oil, like a muscadine grape. Still nicely acidic and plenty of fruit. Lychee, perhaps? Bright yellow-green.

bottle_text:
Moulin de Gassac
Guilhem
2012
Pays D'Herault
notes: Just a good, solid rose. Nothing too fancy, but totally drinkable.
A little grass and mineral. Hay and tangy brine. Closer to a good fino sherry than one would admit. Plenty of tannins. Rich golden yellow.
Salty and just a touch funky. Crisp and clear.
Like seawater, it's so salty. Hay, wax; just wonderful. Best when chilled in the freezer to nearly slushy consistency.

bottle_text:
Falanghina dei Campi Flegrei
Grotta Del Sole
notes: Clean and green. Vinous but still a little sweet. Definitely mineral and melon.

bottle_text:
Occhipinti
SP68
Nero D'Avola E Frappato
Sicilia 2011
notes: One of my favorite reds. Spicy, full of fruit and punch. Low tannins, though with some lightweight earthiness.
I swear to God that this wine tastes like tea. In a good way.
I like it every time I drink it.

bottle_text:
Moulin de Gassac
Guilhem
2012
Pays D'Herault
notes: What a totally acceptable rose for such a good price!

bottle_text:
Moulin de Gassac
Guilhem
2012
Pays D'Herault
notes: This wine literally got me through the summer here.

bottle_text:
Moulin de Gassac
Guilhem
2012
Pays D'Herault
notes: Don't ask. It was a long week.
Immediately very sweet, but follows with an intense and bracing acidity.
Fruitier than expected and a touch sweet. Ruby red and clear. Some very light tannins.

bottle_text:
Occhipinti
SP68
Nero D'Avola E Frappato
Sicilia 2012
notes: Fruity and dry, but with tons of grippy tannins and spicy backbone.

grapes:
25% Malvasia di Candia Aromatica
25% Marsanne
25% Ortrugo (Trebbiano di Tortona)
25% unidentified
notes: I am probably unhealthfully addicted to this wine.

grapes:
25% Malvasia di Candia Aromatica
25% Marsanne
25% Ortrugo (Trebbiano di Tortona)
25% unidentified
notes: Bought by Lee Logan. I would fight and kill a man for a bottle of this wine.
A little funk and fruit. A touch unfocused. Ruby red and slightly cloudy.
Lots of great fruit. Tight tannins. Balance and only a little funky.
Served cold from the freezer, almost slushy. Dear God, it's the best thing ever.
Overly sweet. Thin, little depth.
Heavenly. Balanced acidity; precious, wonderful fruit.

bottle_text:
Dal Maso
Tai Rosso
Colli Berici
notes: Practically rose, it's such a light red. Fruity but dry, with a little bit more mineral than you'd expect. Basically a Beaujolais.
Aggressively pink; not pale and coppery like French rose. Sweeter than I like, but not without some dryness. Berries and some acid.
Yellow-green and clear. Oily and vinous but still clean and with plenty of fruit.
Corked!

bottle_text:
Moulin de Gassac
Guilhem
2011
Pays D'Herault
notes: Light yellow-green. Clear. Fruit, vines, grass. Not too sweet.
Ruby red, almost brick red. Some fruit but tons of good tannins and dry earth. Almost mossy.
Brown to amber and clear. Nutty, salty and dry as a bone. Less hay and wax than a manzanilla, but much more of the roasted nut flavor.

bottle_text:
Dal Maso
Tai Rosso
Colli Berici
notes: Such a lightweight red, it's basically a rose.
Ruby red and clear. Almost oily flavor, like a red Friuliano? Some fruit and few tannins.
Hay yellow and clear. Waxy, dry and salty like a sea breeze. A touch nutty at the end. Just wonderful.
Cloudy orange-to-amber. Immediate barnyard smell. First taste is acid and astringency blending into a bit of sweet fruit before finishing very dry. All kinds of fruit skins and a bolt of sourness.
Clear light yellow. Sweet and a bit oily. Good acid, though. Short finish.
Clear amber-orange. Laser focused tannins. Smell of stone fruit. Bone-dry and phenomenally tasty. Nothing like it. Like Dinavolino only superior in every way.
A little thin. Tannins light, some fruit. Nicely dry but could be better.
Perfectly acceptable, but reminds me of SP68 and that is not a good comparison for this wine.

bottle_text:
Moulin de Gassac
Guilhem
2012
Pays D'Herault
notes: Completely drinkable white. Regrettably simple but otherwise nothing wrong with it.
Medium-cloudy orange. Funky smell, battery-acid tang on first taste but next is earth and some light fruit. Gripping tannins. Lovely.
Thin. White. Liquid.
Very pale, coppery orange. Clear, crisp flavor; only barely tannic.
Not a particularly good example of an En Rama fino. A little salt. A little tang. Expected more of everything.

bottle_text:
Moulin de Gassac
Guilhem
2012
Pays D'Herault
notes: A light and fruity but perfectly drinkable white wine.
Friuliano is a wonderful grape. Lots of stone fruit and peaches and pears. Even some tropical flavors? A little oil and lack of length are the only downsides.

bottle_text:
Occhipinti
SP68
Nero D'Avola E Frappato
Sicilia 2012
notes: Consumed with a marvelous skirt steak. Bombastic fruit, earthy tannins and tons of length. This wine was made for good food.
Funky but controlled. Hay and barnyard and black tea leaves.
Sent with Becky to book club. Good riddance.
Tiny irrepressible bubbles. Yeasty and dry. Basically the only champagne I can drink.
Very tannic; golden and deep. Some good barnyard funk; could use some more fruit, frankly.
Like a baby Amarone.

bottle_text:
Lopez de Heredia
Rioja
2003
Vina Bosconia
notes: Probably too much fruit and dirt for us? It's nothing like an Amarone or a ripasso-style Valpolicella. It's okay but not in my weheelhouse.

bottle_text:
2007
Sweet Claire
California Riesling
Late Harvest
notes: Not bad. But literally nothing like Dulcinea or Baccadoro.
I like this wine more every time I taste it. So much barnyard and such grippy tannins. La Stoppa wines have more fruit. And Denavolo are tangier. But nothing has this much intensity and length.
So good. Fruit but also tea and candle wax. Long and complex finish, turning to a duskier caramel by the end.
Golden yellow. Oily, fruity. Almost no tannins in this mixture. Would have misidentified this as a new world Sauvignon Blanc. I like the 2011 version better.
Light, sweet, and a touch bubbly. Needs more backbone, but not completely unlike Txakoli.
Me: Innocuous white. Becky: I like it. Plenty of Sauv. blanc.
Decent fruit. Lacking a bit of bracing acidity which would improve it. Wouldn't have guessed Albarino.

bottle_text:
Domaine de Montbourgeau
l'Etoile
Cuvee Speciale
notes: Like a Manzanilla sherry made from Chardonnay grapes. Dusky, yeasty, sour and absolutely fantastic.

bottle_text:
Lopez de Heredia
Rioja
2005
Vina Cubillo
notes: Beefy, fruity, grippy and bold.
Way more vanilla than I remember. I didn't actually like this as much as when we used to drink it.
Some red fruit. Light tannins but low mineral. Becky liked it.
Dry, funky, tannic and ancient.
Bog-standard Georgian orange wine, though I'd like more fruit.
White table wine. Insipid but not unpalatable.
As always, raspy and tea-flavored, with copious hay and wet leaves.

bottle_text:
Saint-Bris
Sauvignon Blanc
Vin de Bourgogne
notes: Winter whites are the best thing.

bottle_text:
Occhipinti
SP68
Nero D'Avola E Frappato
Sicilia 2012
notes: I like it every time I drink it.
Pink Txakoli is one of the best things in the whole world. Bump for first spring bottle.
I am haunted by how great this wine is.
I'm never going to find this bottle again. The despair has set in.
A totally reasonable chardonnay.
Like a baby Amarone.

bottle_text:
Moulin de Gassac
Guilhem
2013
Pays D'Herault
notes: Not really a 7.5, but the weather has been so bad that I'm desperate for anything Spring-like.
A totally reasonable chardonnay.

bottle_text:
Eric Texier
AOC Cotes Du Rhone
notes: Some fruit, almost no earth or tannins.
Thin, overly sweet, and mild.

bottle_text:
Moulin de Gassac
Guilhem
2013
Pays D'Herault

Moulin de Gassac
Guilhem
2013
Pays D'Herault

notes: At least it's Manzanilla? Much prefer the La Cigarerra version.
The 2012 version is just not as good as previous years.
Licorice, herbs, lightweight fruit. Some good depth.
Thinner than I expected. Comparatively lightweight. Maybe could use more skin contact?

bottle_text:
Praeger
2006 Aria
Napa Valley
White Port
notes: Off-dry, waxy and hay. Not as sweet as Sauternes but reminiscent? Like a sweet Fino.
Tea, hay and wax. Some good fruit but mostly very dry.
A bit darker and more tannic than the Rebula; more hay and even a little fruit.
A very nice rosato. A light blush pink but properly dry and with some fruit.

grapes:
25% Malvasia di Candia Aromatica
25% Marsanne
25% Ortrugo (Trebbiano di Tortona)
25% unidentified
notes: Every single time, this is fantastic. Shared with colleagues at SRCCON in Philadelphia. Barnyard funk, feet, blue cheese, hay, wax and tea.
Wonderfully dry and tannic. Golden, with tons of tea and dry wet leaves.
Lightweight and grassy, with some tannins. Mostly fruit and stone, though. Some light tea flavors?

bottle_text:
Colutta
Fruiuli
Colli Orientali
Pinot Grigio

notes: Second time around, I definitely taste more tannins, but this is definitely the lightest wine of this genre I can recall tasting.

bottle_text:
Domaine des Cassagnoles
Reserve Selection
Cotes de Gascogne
2013
Cuvee Gros Manseng
notes: Spicy white with acid and fruit undertones.

bottle_text:
Les Vignes de Bila-Haut
Cotes du Rousillon
notes: Solid white; good acidity and some fruit.
Some off-putting flavors I don't remember. Maybe this was an indecent bottle?
A very light version of the Pheasant's Tears; probably the least offensive to a standard palate.

bottle_text:
Conte de Bregonzo
Amarone della Valpolicella
notes: Oh, that was terrible. At least it makes a good sangria? Thin, sweet, uncomplicated. A cheap Amarone tastes like a cheap Amarone.
Nice, dry red. Some light fruit but mostly hefty tannins and leafy funk.
Some good mineral and acid.
Inoffensive, dry, mineral. Not much depth but otherwise completely acceptable.
A bit sour but strong minerals and good heavy structured fruit.

bottle_text:
Chateau de la Roulerie
2012
Les Terrasses
Chenin Blanc
notes: Hefty, but with plenty of fruit to go with the gravel.
Huh. Totally sauv. blanc flavors; some fruit but plenty of bracing acidity.
Dry, nutty, waxy, some earth and light tea.

bottle_text:
Le Mont
Sec 2012
Domaine Huet
Vouvray
notes: Very drinkable. Plenty of acid, fruit and some minerals. Almost oily? Enjoyed it more than the score suggests.
Made this bottle into a cocktail for an impromptu picnic. It's even good like that!
A touch of oil but mostly good strong fruit and plenty of flinty grass.

bottle_text:
Harri Gorri
Pierre rouge
Irouleguy
Brana
notes: Sharp and a little tannic, but good fruit and not at all sweet.

grapes:
25% Malvasia di Candia Aromatica
25% Marsanne
25% Ortrugo (Trebbiano di Tortona)
25% unidentified
notes: It is so good every time.
Best wine at the October book club.
A touch sour, but minerally and bull of hefty complexity.

First sip: A touch bitter and a little tight. Heavy mineral, some tannins. Smell is gravel and stone fruit and some light rubber. Second sip: A bit warmer, some honey maybe? The tannins take a while to grip. Third sip: Less mineral and slightly more fruit. I can start to taste the alcohol. Fourth sip: The fruit is gone; there is a nice bitter almond undertone and handfuls of stone and gravel. There's some tea flavors now. Fifth sip: Identical to fourth. This wine needs to be served wamer than fridge temps.
Better than the Larmandier, but still not something I'd prefer to drink over a nice Jura or something skin-fermented. A little fruit but more eggy toast.

bottle_text:
Champagne
Cramant
Grand Cru
Guy Larmandier
notes: Rich but not terribly bubbly. Some toast. Some egg. It turns out, I don't really like Champagne very much.

grapes:
Debit
Pošip
Maraština
Chardonnay
Pinot Grigio
notes: Strong acid and tannic grip, but never loses the fruit or the barnyard funk. I'm a believer.

bottle_text:
Savennieres
La Jalousie
Domaine du Closel
notes: Flinty and heavy, but there's a little fruit balance there. I like the acid, too. A complete winter white.
Bright, clear and unbelivable focus. Strong tannins but equally strong fruit to match. Good barnyard tang and some useful funk.
A little oily, but there's some flowers to help with that. Very little fruit and not nearly enough acid.

grapes:
Debit
Pošip
Maraština
Chardonnay
Pinot Grigio
notes: This bottle had lighter tannins and less barnyard than I remember, but still very good.
Actually fairly meek when compared to the marketing copy. A very young-tasting Rkatsiteli. Some good fruit but low acidity and very little tannic structure. Sadly, not much funk either.

bottle_text:
Chateau Soucherie
Cuvee Les Rangs de Long
Anjou Blanc
2013
notes: A little too acidic and could use some more body. But nicely gravelly and there's some fruit there.
Glad I'm finally tasting some non-excellent orange wines. This one is inoffensive and has almost zero tannins. Very little sour, too.
Smoky and spicy, but restrained. Would have identified it as a low-fruit Pinot Noir in a blind taste. Almost zero tannins.

grapes:
Debit
Pošip
Maraština
Chardonnay
Pinot Grigio
notes: Yet another tasting of this. It reminds of my favorite Emilia Romagna orange wines with the sour and a touch of funk. But everything is toned down from, say, Dinavolino. It's just that wine turned down to about a 5.
So much fruit. Blackberry predominantly but also some cherry and other berry flavors. Strangely, also plenty of tannin. Little to no smoke or spice. Nothing like leather. Just berries and tea.
Much good fruit and acid, but also a little bit of gravelly mineral. Could be darker or more honeyed, but I won't complain.
What a cool and interesting idea. An aromatized wine-based aperitif, something between a vermouth and a barolo chinato. Could use some more extracted flavor, but I just adore it.

Rare that a wine with this much fruit on the nose delivers so much of it. Tons of good chalk and oyster shell to go with it. A really great bottle. Upgraded to an 8 after a day in the fridge. What a great bottle.
Flint, mineral and stone. But also some decent acid and fruit? I really like this but it woud be so much better if it was a 2008 or 2005.

grapes:
25% Malvasia di Candia Aromatica
25% Marsanne
25% Ortrugo (Trebbiano di Tortona)
25% unidentified
notes: Thick, viscous, funky and tart. Almost some medicinal herbs? Lovely.
Floral and honeyed, perfumed and wide but only an inch deep. Could use more mineral or acid backbone past that first impression.

grapes:
25% Malvasia di Candia Aromatica
25% Marsanne
25% Ortrugo (Trebbiano di Tortona)
25% unidentified

25% Malvasia di Candia Aromatica
25% Marsanne
25% Ortrugo (Trebbiano di Tortona)
25% unidentified
notes: So good; tangy, tannic and delicious. Paired with a crazy bottarga risotto with Alicia Parlapiano.
Red. Berries. Etc. Maybe a little earth, but definitely low-tannin.
Eh. Rose flavored. Almost petillant. But the first rose of the spring? That's worth a 7.0.

bottle_text:
Les Dauphins
Cotes du Rhone
Reserve
notes: I should buy more of this.
Always a good bottle. A little sparkle really makes it interesting.

grapes:
Pinot Noir
Cabernet Franc
Négrette
Gamay Noir
notes: Nice and dry, some fruit but mostly acid. Compared to my winter whites, I would like more structure, but I'm excited to be tasting spring in a bottle.
Nice and dry. Good acidity. Very little fruit up front, but eventually a little bit of berry through the tangy.
Smells a little like sherry -- oxidized, yeasty -- at the first sniff. But it's all tannin and good sour fruit from there.

bottle_text:
Commanderie de Peyrassol
Cotes de Provence
2014
notes: It's good. But it's not as acidic or as fruity as it could be. My $12 roses have been better this year.
A little sweeter than I tend to like, it's got plenty of bracing acidity. I love rose season.

bottle_text:
Les Dauphins
Cotes du Rhone
Reserve
notes: A totally acceptable rose. Remind me why people pay $25 for a bottle like this again?

grapes:
Pinot Noir
Cabernet Franc
Négrette
Gamay Noir
notes: A little less acid than comparable roses we've been drinking. I like it.
Strong fruit notes but with plenty of acidity and a good bass line of wet gravel and some light chalk.
God, I love spring.
My goodness! Plenty of citrusy acid and grippy tanins. Like an Arnold Palmer! Bright lemon peel and citrus to start, finishing long and waxy with hay and black tea.
Much more fully-flavored than you'd expect; time on the lees sucks the pigment out of the product, resulting in a very pale pink.
Sherry meets Savennieres. Nutty, oxidized, yeasty. Yet, within that, some acid, some fruit and a strong gravel note.
Still a very good rose. Not sure it's $10 better than the other ones we drink, but it's very good.
Bracing, fantastic acidity levened by some heavy minerals and the lightest touch of floral fruit.

grapes:
Pinot Noir
Cabernet Franc
Négrette
Gamay Noir
notes: An excellent, slightly acidic rose. Maybe needs a little more fruit or mineral to help cut the acid?

bottle_text:
Domaine Guindon
Muscadet
Coteaux de la Loire
notes: Great example of the genre. Some fruit, some floral smell, good gravel and a touch of acid at the end. Not a ton of depth.
Excellent orange with tons of fruit. A little copper tinge gives way to plenty of warm acid and interesting dusky notes.
Very much a fine specimen, though tough to believe it's twice as expensive. BCFWNB.
Pale copper color but much more muscular flavor than you'd expect. BCFWNB.

grapes:
25% Malvasia di Candia Aromatica
25% Marsanne
25% Ortrugo (Trebbiano di Tortona)
25% unidentified
notes: Bracing, tangy, with great funk and some really present orange fruit and rind.
Excellent bone-dry fruit and a gracious pinch of acid. Pretty copper-pink color.
Bramble berry fruit but with plenty of earth. Very light tannins, though more came through as the wine warmed. Reminds of a Sangiovese or a non-oaky Jumilla?
This is such a great wine. Dark honey, burnt wax, some good citrus peel combined with a superb flinty mineral undercurrent.

bottle_text:
Chateau Soucherie
Cuvee L'Astree
Rose de Loire

Pignoletto
Frizzante
Col Fondo
Alberto
Tedeschi

notes: Makes a wonderful white wine cocktail.

bottle_text:
Vendange 2000
Chateau D'Arlay
Bouteille no 0000 sur 2800

12 Year Old Port
Collector's Edition
125th Anniversary

grapes:
25% Malvasia di Candia Aromatica
25% Marsanne
25% Ortrugo (Trebbiano di Tortona)
25% unidentified

25% Malvasia di Candia Aromatica
25% Marsanne
25% Ortrugo (Trebbiano di Tortona)
25% unidentified

bottle_text:
Scubla
Ribolla & Malvasia
Lo Speziale Biano
